Uses of Class
colorguard.Powerup

    • Uses of Powerup in colorguard

      Subclasses of Powerup in colorguard 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Clone
      Clone is a powerup, hence it extends Powerup.
      class  HighJump
      HighJump class enables a Piece to jump over defenses for 3 turns
      class  HighWall
      HighWall class prevents all enemies from jumping over defenses, excluding Teleporter
      class  Invincibility
      Invincibility is a type of Powerup that makes a Piece immune to tags for 4 turns
      class  Invisibility
      Invisibility class that makes a Piece invisible for some turns
      class  Jailbreak
      Jailbreak is a specific powerup.
      class  MoveBoost
      MoveBoost powerup that increases a Pieces existing movement ability by 1 in all directions for 5 turns.
      class  Paralysis
      Paralysis class that prevents all enemies in a 7 by 7 around a given Piece for 2 turns
      class  RoleReversal
      RoleReversal powerup allows a Piece to tag an opponent on the other side.
      class  Swapper
      Swapper classes flips any 2 given pieces on the board for one side
      class  TagRadius
      TagRadius class gives a Piece the ability to tag enemies in a 5 by 5 square around them.
      class  Throw
      Throw class enables a Piece to throw the flag to a team mate in the enemy starting side.
      Methods in colorguard that return Powerup 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Powerup Colorguard.addNewPowerup​()
      Adds a new Powerup to the board.
      Powerup Piece.getCurrentPowerup​()  
      Powerup Colorguard.getPowerupAtIndex​(int i)
      Gets the Powerup for the current turn at index i
      Powerup Colorguard.nextPowerup​()
      Generates a random Powerup at a random Location Each Powerup has a certain chance, many are different
      Methods in colorguard that return types with arguments of type Powerup 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.LinkedList<Powerup> GameBoard.getBluePowerups​()  
      java.util.LinkedList<Powerup> Colorguard.getCurrentPowerups​()
      Gets the Powerups of the current turn
      java.util.LinkedList<Powerup> GameBoard.getPowerups​()  
      java.util.LinkedList<Powerup> GameBoard.getRedPowerups​()  
      Methods in colorguard with parameters of type Powerup 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Piece.activatePowerup​(Powerup p)
      Sets hasPowerup to true and sets currentPowerup to p
      void GameBoard.addPowerup​(Powerup p, java.lang.String side)
      Adds a Powerup to given side
      void GameBoard.addPowerupToBoard​(Powerup p, Location loc)
      Adds a Powerup to the board at given Location loc Breaks out if location is not valid
      java.lang.String Colorguard.usePowerup​(Powerup powerup, Location pieceLocation)
      Uses given Powerup on Piece at pieceLocation
